translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The forward and reverse order of conditions in relation to the mental factors, the triplets, and the Paṭṭhāna text

original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)🔽16.78. Sanidassanattika, Dassanenapahātabbaduka🔽Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ dassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanidassanaappaṭigho nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā cha, adhipatiyā cha …pe… avigate cha.🔽Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ nadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nasanidassanasappaṭigho🔽nanadassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ nadassanena
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  sani dassana ttika dassanena apahātabba duka  anidassana appaṭigham dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na anidassana appaṭighaḥ na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta  hetuyā cha adhipatiyā cha pe avigate cha  a nidassana appaṭigham na dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paccayā na sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ  na na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā anidassana appaṭigham na dassanena
translated: The visible-data-base, the three kinds of objects to be abandoned by seeing,🔽With respect to a visible-data-base that is not-inconstant and not-inconstant-in-contact, a visible-data-base that is not-inconstant and not-inconstant-in-contact arises with root-cause condition. (In brief.)

original: pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā naanidassanasappaṭigho nanadassanena pahātabbo dhammo🔽uppajjati hetupaccayā. Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ nadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā
analyzed: pahātabbam dhammam paccayā na a nidassana sa paṭighaḥ na na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ 🔽uppajjati hetu paccayā anidassana appaṭigham na dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paccayā
translated: With respect to a visible-data-base that is not-inconstant and not-inconstant-in-contact, a visible-data-base that is not-inconstant and not-inconstant-in-contact arises with predominance condition. … With respect to a visible-data-base that is not-inconstant and not-inconstant-in-contact, a visible-data-base that is not-inconstant and not-inconstant-in-contact arises with non-causality condition. … With respect to a visible-data-base that is not-inconstant and not-inconstant-in-contact, a visible-data-base that is not-inconstant and not-inconstant-in-contact arises with absence-of-ignorance condition. … With respect to a visible-data-base that is not-inconstant and not-inconstant-in-contact, a visible-data-base that is not-inconstant and not-inconstant-in-contact arises with non-conflict condition. … With respect to a visible-data-base that is not-inconstant and not-inconstant-in-contact, a visible-data-base that is not-inconstant and not-inconstant-in-contact arises with non-violence condition. … With respect to a visible-data-base that is not-inconstant and not-inconstant-in-contact, a visible-data-base that is not-inconstant and not-inconstant-in-contact arises with lightness condition. … With respect to a visible-data-base that is not-inconstant and not-inconstant-in-contact, a visible-data-base that is not-inconstant and not-inconstant-in-contact arises with malleability condition. … With respect to a visible-data-base that is not-inconstant and not-inconstant-in-contact

original: nasanidassanasappaṭigho nanadassanena pahātabbo ca naanidassanasappaṭigho nanadassanena🔽pahātabbo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ na na dassanena pahātabbaḥ ca na a nidassana sa paṭighaḥ na na dassanena  pahātabbo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: and the ideas that are not-to-be-directly-known-and-not-to-be-directly-experienced are abandoned by direct-knowledge, and the ideas that are not-to-be-directly-known-and-not-to-be-directly-experienced are abandoned by direct-knowledge,🔽are ideas that arise with resultant condition. (Abbreviated.)🔽🔽
